title: The Learjet 45 pressurization system maintains a cabin altit…
caption_en: The Learjet 45 pressurization system maintains a cabin altitude much lower than actual airplane altitude. This is accomplished by controlling the outflow of air that has been provided to the cockpit and cabin through the pneumatic, air-conditioning and ventilation distribution systems.

title: Only the cockpit and the passenger cabin sections are pressu…
caption_en: Only the cockpit and the passenger cabin sections are pressurized. The forward pressure bulkhead separates the cockpit from the nose avionics bay. The aft pressure bulkhead separates the passenger cabin from the fuselage fuel tank.

title: OutFlow Valves The 2 outflow valves, Primary (PRI) and Secon…
caption_en: OutFlow Valves The 2 outflow valves, Primary (PRI) and Secondary (SEC) are located on the forward pressure bulkhead. They are controlled by the Cabin Pressurization Controller or to modulate the outflow of air from the pressurized fuselage.

title: They are spring-loaded closed and their control chambers are…
caption_en: They are spring-loaded closed and their control chambers are inter-connected such that they operate in tandem. An electro-pneumatic torque motor controls the operating pressure. Ambient pressure, cabin pressure, spring pressure and vacuum (negative pressure) are all factors affecting the position of the outflow valve.

title: Cabin-to-atmospheric differential pressure (Delta P) relief …
caption_en: Cabin-to-atmospheric differential pressure (Delta P) relief valves are located on each outflow valve to limit cabin pressure if a system malfunction causes over-pressurization. The Delta P limiters operate pneumatically and are independent of all other operating modes.

title: The outflow valves will open when the differential pressure …
caption_en: The outflow valves will open when the differential pressure (Delta P) reaches psid at nominal airflows. If one of the Delta P limiter fails, the remaining Delta P limiter will limit differential pressure to slightly higher than psid.

title: Each outflow valve has a cabin altitude limiter. If the cabi…
caption_en: Each outflow valve has a cabin altitude limiter. If the cabin altitude climbs and reaches feet for whatever reason, the altitude limiters will pneumatically close the outflow valves in an attempt to keep the cabin altitude from climbing any higher.

title: Negative Pressure Relief The outflow valves are designed to …
caption_en: Negative Pressure Relief The outflow valves are designed to keep pressure in the cabin. But if the outside atmospheric pressure is greater than the inside cabin pressure by psid (negative pressure), both the outflow valves will open.

title: Cabin Pressure Controller System The cabin pressure controll…
caption_en: Cabin Pressure Controller System The cabin pressure controller or is located in front of the co-pilot. itis a dual channel controller and regulates the pressurization system. The pressurization circuit breakers are found under the Environmental group.

title: The left or primary channel controls the PRI outflow valve o…
caption_en: The left or primary channel controls the PRI outflow valve only. It is powered by the Left Main Bus via the PRI PRESS circuit breaker. The right or secondary channel controls the SEC outflow valve only. It is powered by the Emergency Battery Bus via the SEC PRESS circuit breaker.

title: The primary or left channel normally provides the pressuriza…
caption_en: The primary or left channel normally provides the pressurization control functions, but either channel can provide all automatic or manual pressurization control functions with a power failure to the other channel. The inter-connecting line enables both outflow valves to operate with either channel in control.

title: The switches and indications associated with pressurization …
caption_en: The switches and indications associated with pressurization are as shown within the 2 yellow boxes. These are the ALT selector, MAN PRESS switch and MANUAL rate selector, EMER PRESS switch, EMER DEPRESS switch and the displays for CAB RATE, DELTAP and CABALT.

title: There are 3 modes of pressurization, namely - the automatic …
caption_en: There are 3 modes of pressurization, namely - the automatic mode,
